content.text: Once upon a time, there was a small village of Vikings, no larger than toy figures, who sailed through time and suddenly landed in the heart of Berlin. Imagine their surprise when they moored their wooden ships on the banks of the Spree and were surrounded by giant buildings and glowing carriages - or as we call them, cars.

content.contentDescription: Several tiny Vikings in Viking rowboats on the Spree river in Berlin.

content.text: At first, the tiny Vikings were very confused. "What kind of magic is this?" asked the leader, pointing to a blinking traffic light. "And why is that wall moving by itself?" he added as a subway train rushed past them.

content.contentDescription: Three tiny Vikings stand and point confused at a traffic light.

content.text: But Vikings are known for their adaptability and spirit of exploration. They decided to explore this new world. They climbed onto bicycles, which seemed like giant battleships to them, and set off to discover more.

content.contentDescription: A tiny Viking rides a bicycle through the traffic of Berlin, as two others run beside on foot controlling the pedals.

content.text: Their first stop was the famous Alexanderplatz, where they mingled with the crowds. People barely noticed them, distracted by their cell phones and the hustle and bustle of the city. The Vikings were fascinated by the many food stalls. "What a feast!" they exclaimed, trying a piece of Döner that was almost as big as they were.

content.contentDescription: A tiny Viking walks along holding an entire Döner kebab spit in his hands, looking very pleased with himself.

content.text: After they had regained their strength, the Vikings resumed their journey. They passed a place that appeared to be full of treasures – an electronics store. They marveled at the shimmering screens and strange devices, which they mistook for magical artifacts.

content.contentDescription: Three tiny Vikings look in amazed wonder at a tablet computer in an electronics store.

content.text: At the end of the day, the tiny Vikings were exhausted but happy. They had learned a lot about the modern world and decided to make Berlin their new home. Every day they would experience a new adventure, but for today, it was enough for them to sleep under the starry sky beside their familiar Spree.

content.contentDescription: Tiny Vikings standing side by side on their longboat, looking at the river and the city skyline of Berlin at night.
